question: Getting Prepared
data: It makes sense to take some common sense precautions in case of disruption.
🍕 FOOD: Consider stocking supplies of long-life items like pasta, canned foods, rice, etc.
💊 MEDICATIONS: If you take medication, make sure you have sufficient supplies in your house.
🧻 TOILETRIES: Hand sanitizer, soap, toilet roll, sanitary products, etc.
🐶 PETS: Don't forget the needs of your fury friends!

question: Symptoms
data: COVID-19 causes flu-like symptoms, typically starting with a fever 🤒, followed by a dry cough .
It rarely seems to cause a runny nose 👃, sneezing 🤧, or sore throat. Those symptoms are more likely signs of a cold.
In some patients - particularly the elderly and others with other chronic health conditions, it can develop into pneumonia, with chest tightness, chest pain, and shortness of breath.

question: Protecting Yourself
data: The best way to protect yourself from COVID-19 is to reduce personal contact. Here are some simple tips

✅ Make a habit of frequently washing your hands 🤲 with soap 🧼 and water 💧 or an alcohol-based hand wash. DO THIS: after visiting the bathroom 🚽, after travelling on public transport 🚂, and before eating 🍽
✅ Reduce personal contact - e.g. avoid shaking 🤝 hands and keep at least 1️⃣-2️⃣ metres away from other people and avoid crowded places.
✅ Cover your mouth 👄 and nose 👃 with a tissue or your sleeve (not your hands) when you cough or sneeze 🤧
✅ Consider getting a flu jag 💉, to avoid the possibility of acquiring both COVID-19 and flu at the same time.
❌ Avoid touching your eyes 👁, nose 👃 or mouth 👄 with your hands.
❌ Try to avoid crowded places where it's difficult to stay over 1 metre from others.
